subject: Communication
title: Listening to What's Not Said
description: A quick, practical guide to Listening to What's Not Said.

hook.text: 'I'm fine,' she said. Her voice cracked. Her eyes were red. The words said fine. Everything else screamed the opposite.

buildup.text: Research suggests 60-90% of communication is nonverbal. Empathetic listeners attend to tone, pace, pauses, and body.

discovery.text: What people omit is as revealing as what they say. A person describing their day who skips over the morning may be.

twist.text: Naming the unspoken is powerful but risky: 'It sounds like there's something else going on.

climax.text: The deepest empathetic listening tunes into the gap between words and meaning â€” where the real message often hides.

punchline.text: Listen to the silences. They often say more than the words do.
